Title: Good And Tough!
Cons: Lens cap falls off too easy
Pros:
I bought this to use on the Bike Rides I do around town and wished i had a picture of this and that.  Then I stared a new Job that requires me to take Pic's of the work i do installin Satelite for Dish Network. .I have to say I have drop the Camera of the ladder on accident 3 times from as high as 15 foot off the ground to the lawn. Once it bounced of a aircondtioner unit from 10 foot drop. Each time  I'd get down off the ladder thinking it was toast.  NO WAY It surrvied!  and still works just as great as the 1st day I bought it. . It's also fell out fo my truch a few time's from my foot get caught up in the strap and hit the ground (Concrete) a few time hard enough to put a gash in one side of the plastic case and eveything  Still A OK!!

I guess I'm not a camera type of person but this thing can handel my clumsyness

I bought this with the pinter doc combo at a online camera store  for about $315 last year
Comments: Hope this helps on making your decision. . .

Title: Not bad for the price.
Cons: The only reason this got 4 eggs from me is because the night mode is REALLY freaking hard to keep steady.  You need a tripod to not make the picture blurry.  Also, it takes a while to auto focus in certain situations.  Other than that, nice.
Pros: The 10x optical zoom is VERY nice.  The digital zoom is also not too bad or too jerky, unless you're on full 50x (total zoom).  Takes beautiful pictures!

Title: Great Camera!
Cons: None.
Pros: Nice lens, nice quality photos, easy to use - my wife loves the kodak software. I'm a novice, but in not time was taking great action shots of my bounding Jack Russel. I took a nice picture of the cockpit controls from about 20 rows back in coach using the two zooms (5x opt 5x dig). In shopping around, this is the best deal for an SLR like camera. 6 months later, I have no regrets.

Cons: None
Pros: I have had this camera for 6 months and have not had to change the batteries once.  The pictures are great and easy to use.
Comments: Great camera for the price.

Title: A+
Cons: The Kodak software included seems limited but there are some great photo editors out there that are completely free.
Pros: This camera is great.  It has a 10 X optical zoom and has an easy user interface.  It takes extremely clear photos and it came with a free bag to boot when I bought it.
Comments: Great Everday use camera.  Buy it you won't regret it.

Title: Z740 OK by amateur standards
Cons: Creative control lacking, I was looking for more. Keep your right index finger away from the low level light focus assist.
Pros: This camera is a simple point-shoot automatic. Creative control envolves the addition of auxilliary lenses. Prints come out well balanced and sharp when using the Series 3 printer dock. They use a process called "thermal dye sublimation" You will not be disappointed.
Comments: I gave the P880 some serious thought. I went for it and gave my son the Z740. They both use the same Series 3 printer dock, and both result in excellent prints, even 2x3 Multi-up. I have been a Kodak staunch since the 70's. They know their science.

Title: Great Camera From Kodak
Cons:
Autofocus a tad slow.  Also, if you want to take a lot of quick pictures turn of the preview or you have to keep touching the focus button.  
I would have preferred a through the lens view instead of a mini-lcd in the view finder but I am getting used to it.
Pros:
Awesome pictures.  The colors are vibrant and sharp.  It has some real nice features like a 'full manual' mode for true photograpers.  

Good auto-focus features for a low-priced digital camera.  

The 10X optical zoom can be intimidating because it gets you so close but the pics are sharp throughout the range of the lens.  I turned off the digital zoom because it's not needed.

A wonderful replacement for my old 2MP Fuji.
Comments: What else is there to say but "Newegg is the best".

Title: Amazing Camera for my Parents
Cons:
The thumb joystick is pretty small.  I don't have a problem with it at all, but my dad has huge fingers and its a little hard for him to control.

Also, the LCD screen is a little small.
Pros: 10x optical zoom. =)  Amazing picture quality.  It fits in my hands rather nice.  Its got a nice look to it. Loads more features than I expected at $xxx
Comments: I purchased this camera for my parents.  My dad is in his 70's and I wanted them to have a camera that was very easy to use.  Besides taking pictures of family they also take pictures of wildlife when they are up in the hills.  10x optical zoom at this price is just amazing.

Title: Great Camera
Cons:
Battery could have been rechargable......
Other than that I can't think of anything....
Pros:
Excellent Zoom... 
Easy to use...
Nice Grip...
Sharp Pictures....
Multiple settings to play with...
Comments: I didn't buy this camera from Newegg, but its great camera. I knw very little about digital cameras, and evem I can take excellent pictures. Would recoment to anyone. The zoom is awsome.

Title: LIttle Camera That Could
Cons:
The only problem that I have is that I am horrible at taking pictures. 
With my new camera I am sure that I will become a pro.
Pros:
A neat little camera for the price.
Easy to follow guides and instructions. 
I especially enjoy taking pictures in Sports mode. I can take pictures quickly which I love. It makes my old camera look like a garbage, which at this point it essentially is.
Comments: Anyone who wants a funny easy camera to use. I would definitely recommend this.
